text: I have a question. An API call returns a very large response (movie cast and crew list) but I want a small amount of the data in it. The position of the data I want might change so I don't think I can destructure it. Is there some way to just call for the pieces I want that I'm not thinking of? Or does it not really matter generally how large the API response is?

elements.text: I have a question. An API call returns a very large response (movie cast and crew list) but I want a small amount of the data in it. The position of the data I want might change so I don't think I can destructure it. Is there some way to just call for the pieces I want that I'm not thinking of? Or does it not really matter generally how large the API response is?

text: depends on the API you are using.

elements.text: depends on the API you are using.

text: generally the bigger the API response, the more data has to be sent, and that's slowing down the request.

elements.text: generally the bigger the API response, the more data has to be sent, and that's slowing down the request.

text: hence many APIs give you ways of specifying -> which data you need, how much you need etc.

elements.text: they do this via query params, or another way?

text: If you have an array with only one object inside it and you want it to simply be an object, is Object.assign the best way, or is there a way to do it with .reduce that I can't figure out?

elements.text: If you have an array with only one object inside it and you want it to simply be an object, is Object.assign the best way, or is there a way to do it with .reduce that I can't figure out?

text: const [obj] = arr

elements.text: const [obj] = arr

text: array destructuring is pretty useful. :slightly_smiling_face:

text: <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Destructuring_assignment>
alternatively you could even do const obj = arr[0]

text: now both of these assume that there is ALWAYS at least 1 thing in the array. if that's not true they might return undefined or even break...
